title: Thunderbird 54.0beta Beta

notes.note: Better support for Charter/Spectrum IMAP: Thunderbird will now detect Charter's IMAP service and send an additional IMAP select command to the server. Check the various preferences ending in "force_select" to see whether auto-detection has discovered this case.
Thunderbird now uses Mozilla's latest proxy technology (add-on FoxyProxy now supported)
Embedded images not shown in email received from Hotmail/Outlook webmailer
Detection of non-ASCII font names in font selector
Attachment not forwarded correctly under certain circumstances
Attached message sometimes not saved or forwarded correctly
Mailing list (group) not accessible from macOS or Outlook address book (not working in Thunderbird version 52)
Multiple requests for master password when GMail OAuth2 is enabled
Chat working again (fixed in Thunderbird version 54 beta 2, wasn't working in beta 1)

Clicking on links with references/anchors not working, clicking on links with references/anchors where target doesn't exist in the message not opening in external browser (fixed in Thunderbird version 54 beta 3, wasn't working in beta 1 and 2)
Large number of blank pages being printed under certain circumstances when invalid preferences were present (fixed in Thunderbird version 54 beta 3)
Messages sent via the Simple MAPI interface are forced to HTML
Crash due to incompatibility with McAfee Anti-SPAM add-on. **Workaround:** Start in safe mode and disable McAfee Anti-Spam Extension

Date/time display cannot be adjusted in the operating system settings, so the date/time display will follow the application locale. That means that the English-US version will display English-US date/time formats and, for example, the German version will display German date/time formats. Improved behavior scheduled for version 55 beta.

text: **These release notes apply to Thunderbird version 54 beta 3 released June 2nd, 2017.**
system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8
 - Windows 10
 - Windows Server 2008 R2

*Please note that while the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows can be used to run Thunderbird, only 32-bit builds of Thunderbird are supported at this time.*

**Note that Thunderbird 54 only supports Windows 7, 8 and 10 and Windows Server 2008 R2.**
  
### Windows Recommended Hardware
   - Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
   - 1GB RAM
   - 200 MB hard drive space

---

## Mac
  
### Operating Systems
  
- Mac OS X 10.9
- Mac OS X 10.10
- Mac OS X 10.11
- Mac OS X 10.12
  
###  Recommended Hardware
  
 -  Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
 -  512 MB RAM
 -  200 MB hard drive space

---
  
## GNU/Linux
### Software Requirements
  
  *Please note that Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*
  
### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Thunderbird will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - GTK+ 3.4 or higher
    - GLib 2.22 or higher
    - Pango 1.14 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    - libstdc++ 4.6.1 or higher
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - GNOME 2.16 or higher
